description:
11.73 dnn_detect
Do object detection with deep neural networks.

The filter accepts the following options:

backend_configs.description: Set the configs to be passed into backend. To use async execution, set async (default: set). Roll back to sync execution if the backend does not support async.

dnn_backend.description: Specify which DNN backend to use for model loading and execution. This option accepts only openvino now, tensorflow backends will be added.

input.description: Set the input name of the dnn network.

labels.description: Set path to label file specifying the mapping between label id and name. Each label name is written in one line, tailing spaces and empty lines are skipped. The first line is the name of label id 0 (usually it is 'background'), and the second line is the name of label id 1, etc. The label id is considered as name if the label file is not provided.

model.description: Set path to model file specifying network architecture and its parameters. Note that different backends use different file formats.

output.description: Set the output name of the dnn network.

name: dnn_detect

parameters.description: Set path to model file specifying network architecture and its parameters. Note that different backends use different file formats.
parameters.name: model

parameters.description: Set the input name of the dnn network.
parameters.name: input

parameters.description: Set the output name of the dnn network.
parameters.name: output

parameters.description: Set path to label file specifying the mapping between label id and name. Each label name is written in one line, tailing spaces and empty lines are skipped. The first line is the name of label id 0 (usually it is ’background’), and the second line is the name of label id 1, etc. The label id is considered as name if the label file is not provided.
parameters.name: labels

parameters.description: Set the configs to be passed into backend. To use async execution, set async (default: set). Roll back to sync execution if the backend does not support async.
parameters.name: backend_configs

source:
11.73 dnn_detect

Do object detection with deep neural networks.

The filter accepts the following options:

dnn_backend

Specify which DNN backend to use for model loading and execution. This option accepts only openvino now, tensorflow backends will be added.

model

Set path to model file specifying network architecture and its parameters. Note that different backends use different file formats.

input

Set the input name of the dnn network.

output

Set the output name of the dnn network.

confidence

Set the confidence threshold (default: 0.5).

labels

Set path to label file specifying the mapping between label id and name. Each label name is written in one line, tailing spaces and empty lines are skipped. The first line is the name of label id 0 (usually it is ’background’), and the second line is the name of label id 1, etc. The label id is considered as name if the label file is not provided.

backend_configs

Set the configs to be passed into backend. To use async execution, set async (default: set). Roll back to sync execution if the backend does not support async.
